title: 114_hr5099
content: The "CHIP IN for Vets Act of 2016" authorizes a pilot program for the Department of Veterans Affairs to accept donations of real property and facilities from entities for veterans' use. The "CHIP IN for Vets Act of 2016" authorizes a pilot program for the Department of Veterans Affairs to accept donations of real property and facilities from entities for veterans' use. Entities eligible for donation include State or local authorities, 501(c)(3) organizations, limited liability corporations, private entities, donors, and non-Federal Government entities. The Secretary may accept up to five donations of real property and facility improvements under the pilot program. The pilot program allows the Department of Veterans Affairs to accept donations of property for facility projects if the property meets specific criteria and an entity agrees to a formal agreement with the Secretary. The pilot program allows the Department of Veterans Affairs to accept donations of real property and improvements for facility projects if an entity agrees to independently donate the property or construct a facility on Department property, as per an agreement with the Secretary. The Department of Veterans Affairs can accept donations of real property and improvements for facility projects if an entity agrees to independently donate the property or construct a facility on Department property. The formal agreement with the entity must include conducting necessary environmental and historic preservation due diligence, complying with local zoning requirements, and obtaining all required permits for construction. The entity must also adhere to construction standards required by the Department. The entity must provide real property, improvements, goods, or services as described in subsection (b)(2) to complete facility construction at no additional cost to the Federal Government. The Secretary cannot pay rent, usage fees, or any other amounts for the use of donated real property or improvements. The Secretary is prohibited from providing funds to help finance, design, or construct a facility in connection with donated real property and improvements. The Secretary shall provide funds under terms and conditions determined appropriate for the donation of real property and improvements by an entity described in subsection (a)(2). The entity donating a facility must provide additional funds as per a formal agreement entered into under subsection (c). The Department will provide necessary amounts to complete facility construction. Entities seeking to donate property must submit an application addressing Department needs. The Secretary will report on donated property in the annual budget. The Secretary will report on donations of real property and facility projects in the annual budget. The Comptroller General of the United States will submit a biennial report on donation agreements under the pilot program. The authority for the Secretary to accept donations will terminate 5 years after the enactment of the Act. The Secretary has the authority to enter into agreements authorized by law and not inconsistent with this section, even after the termination of the donation acceptance authority 5 years after the Act's enactment.
